title: How to prepare an answer for every question - Quora

response.answer_text: This will be a short answer but it is something I noticed about my answers and wonder if this is true for anyone else. My answers are by revelation or inspiration. At the time I decide to answer a question I know what I want to say. I have an analytical mind. Made my living that way. But when looking back through my answers I find if I had to answer those questions again I really doubt I could come up with a similar answer. By saying my answers are by revelation don't mean to sound spooky. Most of my answers bomb. I'm a bottom dweller. So revelation is a bad choice of words but at the time not counting the answers I researched, what I wrote originally and then looking back I develop writer's block. Just wondering if anyone else notices this about their writing.

It’s all around us ! People, nature, things & experiences ! If we could observe them closely, everyone can become a writer ! All you have to do is just express yourself. Simple !! Whenever you write something, make sure it is the best among the thread ! *at least you should feel that after reading your own answer*  If I feel my words would add value to the question/quora, I just answer it ! A bit of research ! A pinch of creativity ! A touch of humor ! A collage of thoughts ! Handful of time ! & Spine full of patience !! (*_*) *ufff* :P is all you need for a perfect answer ! :)  Thanks for your time :) Image Source : Google P.S : Thanks for the A2A User-12701371950577750298
